body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

I cloned the develop version of spack and called `. spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh` and got the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/homes/mdorier/spack/bin/spack", line 67, in <module>
    import spack.main  # noqa
  File "/nfs2/mdorier/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 28, in <module>
    from llnl.util.tty.log import log_output
  File "/nfs2/mdorier/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/tty/log.py", line 23, in <module>
    from typing import Optional  # novm
ImportError: No module named 'typing'
```

The error doesn't show up with the latest release (0.16.1). My platform has python 2.7.6 and python 3.4.3. [This page](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting_started.html) indicates that 2.7 should work fine.
title: Can't setup spack: ImportError: No module named 'typing'
